Question
========

In a class there are 7 girls and six boys. We randomly choose one of the 13 students. From the remaining 12 pupils we then another student at random. A is the event that the first chosen person is a girl. B is the event that the second chosen person is a girl. \ I. The probabilities of the two events A and B are equal._____________. II. A and B are independent events. \ Choose the correct answer from the following alternatives.

Answerlist
----------

* I is TRUE and II is false.
* I is TRUE and II is false.
* I is false and II is true.
* I is false and II is false.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* I is TRUE and II is TRUE: Incorrect
* I is TRUE and II is false: Incorrect
* I is false and II is true: Incorrect
* I is false and II is false: Correct
